lines.text:
[Mrs. McChesney is explaining to her adopted daughter why a little boy at school called her a bast---]
That word at school. It frightened you, didn't it? Do you know what it means?

Well, now, it's not really bad at all! Some people think it's bad just because they don't understand. You see, Patsy, what happened was that a lovely young girl met a handsome young man and they fell in love, but for some reason they couldn't get married. I don't know what the reason was, and it doesn't matter, but their sin is not yours, and they're paying for it terribly.
Because they haven't got you, sweetheart.
Mr. McChesney always uses a long word whenever he can avoid a short one.
